spec.name: Query
spec.description: Executes a structured query against the FDM Graph to find nodes matching specific criteria. Delegates to the QueryService.

args.name: filter
args.description:
A map defining constraints. Supported keys:
  - 'type' (string): The NodeType to search for.
  - 'fields' (map): A nested map of exact field matches (key=FieldName, value=Value).

args.name: limit
args.description: The maximum number of results to return. Defaults to system limit if omitted.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of NSEntity maps representing matched Nodes.
spec.errorConditions: Fails if 'filter' is not a map, or if 'fields' is provided but is not a map.

spec.name: RegisterOverlay
spec.description: Creates and registers a standard, named overlay required by a script.

args.name: overlayName
args.description: The name of the overlay to register (e.g., 'forum:vote').

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on success or if already registered.

spec.name: ListMeta
spec.description: Lists metadata for all registered overlays.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of maps, where each map contains metadata about an overlay: id, kind, label, node_count, file_count

spec.name: Find
spec.description: Finds all definitions of a given Go symbol.

args.name: symbolName
args.description: The exact name of the symbol to find (e.g., 'NewFDM').

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of maps, each detailing a symbol definition with keys: 'file', 'pos', 'kind', 'recv'.

spec.name: Create
spec.description: Creates a new, empty ingest_plan node for a given repository path.

args.name: repoPath
args.description: The local filesystem path to the repository to be ingested.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the NSEntity object of the newly created ingest_plan.

spec.name: AddOverlay
spec.description: Adds an overlay to an ingest_plan, creating a new version of the plan.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity object.

spec.name: AddIndex
spec.description: Adds an index to an ingest_plan, creating a new version of the plan.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity object.

spec.name: AddIgnorePatterns
spec.description: Adds a list of glob patterns to an ingest_plan's ignore list.

args.name: planObj
args.description: The NSEntity object of the ingest_plan to modify.

args.name: patterns
args.description: A list of glob patterns to add (e.g., ['**/node_modules', '*.log']).

spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity object.

spec.name: SetRespectGitignore
spec.description: Sets whether the ingestion plan should respect .gitignore files.

args.name: planObj
args.description: The NSEntity object of the ingest_plan to modify.

args.name: respect
args.description: Set to true to respect .gitignore, false to ignore it.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity object.

spec.name: AddExcludeMIMETypes
spec.description: Adds a list of MIME types to the plan's exclusion list.

args.name: planObj
args.description: The NSEntity object of the ingest_plan to modify.

args.name: mimeTypes
args.description: A list of MIME type strings to exclude (e.g., ['image/png', 'application/pdf']).

spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity object.

spec.name: Ingest
spec.description: Executes a full ingestion process by walking the entire repository based on a specified ingest_plan.

args.name: planObj
args.description: The NSEntity object of the ingest_plan to execute.

args.name: repoName
args.description: Optional: Explicit name for the repository (e.g., 'fdm'). Defaults to directory name.

args.name: queueID
args.description: Optional: The NodeID of an existing WorkQueue. If omitted, one is created.

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on successful completion of the ingestion.

spec.name: IngestChanges
spec.description: Executes an incremental ingestion process for a specified list of changed files.

args.name: planObj
args.description: The NSEntity object of the ingest_plan to use for context.

args.name: filePaths
args.description: A list of file paths that have been added or changed.

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on successful completion of the incremental ingestion.

spec.name: AssignModel
spec.description: Assigns a specific AI model to an agent node by creating a new version of the node.

args.name: did
args.description: The DID of the agent to modify.

args.name: modelName
args.description: The registered name of the model to assign (e.g., 'gpt-4o').

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map representing the updated agent node.

spec.name: SetRole
spec.description: Sets the 'core:role' field on an agent node, creating a new version.

args.name: agent_entity
args.description: The agent NSEntity object (map) to update.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map representing the updated agent node.

spec.name: LoadScriptSigned
spec.description: Updates an agent node with a script path and signature, creating a new version.

args.name: agent_entity
args.description: The agent NSEntity object (map) to update.

args.name: script_path
args.description: The path or identifier for the agent's script source.

args.name: signature
args.description: The signature verifying the script's authenticity.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map representing the updated agent node.

spec.name: init_identity
spec.description: Initializes a new core identity (FDM or SAI). Privileged.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a map containing details of the created identity (name, ulid, did, public_key, created_at, storage_uri).

spec.name: register_agent
spec.description: Creates a signed agent node in the FDM. Privileged.

args.name: storage_uri
args.description: The storage URI of the agent's identity document.

args.name: script_capsule
args.description: The capsule URI for the agent's script (e.g., 'capsule/my-agent').

args.name: agent_model
args.description: The registered name of the model for the agent (e.g., 'gpt-4o').

args.name: charter_capsule_id
args.description: The capsule name/URI for the agent's charter (e.g., 'capsule/sai_charter').

spec.returnHelp: Returns an NSEntity map representing the newly created agent node.

spec.name: is_identity_set
spec.description: Returns true if the FDM core identity has already been set.
spec.returnHelp: Returns true if the core identity is set, false otherwise.

spec.name: grant_caps
spec.description: Grants one or more capabilities to an agent by creating grant nodes.

args.name: agent_obj
args.description: The agent NSEntity object to grant capabilities to.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of NSEntity maps, each representing a created grant node.

spec.name: set_agent_descriptor
spec.description: Creates or updates an agent's runtime descriptor node.
spec.returnHelp: Returns an NSEntity map representing the created agent descriptor node.

spec.name: get_sai_did
spec.description: Returns the DID of the Supervising AI (SAI), which is the core identity of the FDM.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the DID string of the SAI, or an error if not set.

spec.name: set_sai_did
spec.description: Sets the DID of the Supervising AI (SAI) for the FDM instance. Privileged.

args.name: did
args.description: The DID to set for the SAI.

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on success.

spec.name: Publish
spec.description: Publishes a message to a topic on the FDM event bus (fire-and-forget). Payload must be Base64 encoded. Source is automatically set from the calling agent's context.

args.name: payload_base64
args.description: Base64 encoded string representing the payload bytes.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the unique message ID assigned to the published event.

spec.name: Request
spec.description: Sends a request message and waits for a reply. Request payload must be Base64 encoded. Source is automatically set from the calling agent's context.

args.name: payload_base64
args.description: Base64 encoded string representing the request payload bytes.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the reply payload as a string, or an error on timeout.

spec.name: admin_add_mount
spec.description: Adds a mount point to the persistence router (privileged).
spec.returnHelp: Returns a confirmation message.

spec.name: admin_add_alias
spec.description: Adds an alias to the persistence router (privileged).
spec.returnHelp: Returns a confirmation message.

spec.name: put
spec.description: Saves a value to the persistence layer.
spec.returnHelp: Returns 'ok' on success.

spec.name: get
spec.description: Retrieves a value from the persistence layer.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the stored value as a string, or nil if not found.

spec.name: list
spec.description: Lists keys and values under a given URI prefix.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a map where keys are full URIs and values are stored strings.

spec.name: delete
spec.description: Deletes a value from the persistence layer.
spec.returnHelp: Returns 'ok' on success.

spec.name: patch
spec.description: Applies a diff patch to a file, writes it to disk, and triggers relevant FDM updates via events.

args.name: path
args.description: The repository-relative path to the file to patch.

args.name: patchText
args.description: The patch content in standard diff format.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with 'accepted': true and 'receipt_id' on success.

spec.name: read
spec.description: Reads the content of a file from the FDM Graph (not disk). Supports Path, NodeID (N_), or EntityID (E_).

args.name: identifier
args.description: The repository-relative path OR NodeID/EntityID of the file to read.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the full text content of the file.

spec.name: list
spec.description: Lists all file paths currently indexed by the File Overlay.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a sorted list of file paths.

spec.name: CreateEntity
spec.description: Creates a new Semantic Entity. Returns the NSEntity object {id, _version, _type, fields...}.

args.name: id
args.description: The new stable Entity ID (must start with E_).

spec.returnHelp: Returns the NSEntity map.

spec.name: UpdateEntity
spec.description: Updates an existing Entity. Enforces Optimistic Locking by requiring the full 'entity' object with '_version'.

args.name: entity
args.description: The NSEntity object to update (must contain 'id' and '_version').

spec.returnHelp: Returns the updated NSEntity map with the new _version.

spec.name: GetEntity
spec.description: Retrieves the current state (Head) of an Entity by its ID string.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the NSEntity map, or nil if not found.

spec.name: DeleteEntity
spec.description: Deletes (tombstones) an Entity. Requires the entity object to ensure you are deleting the version you think you are.
spec.returnHelp: Returns true on success.

spec.name: GetRoots
spec.description: Retrieves the root entities of a given FSI index.

args.name: index_id
args.description: The ID of the FSI index.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of NSEntity objects.

spec.name: GetChildren
spec.description: Retrieves the child entities of a given parent entity in an FSI index.

args.name: index_id
args.description: The ID of the FSI index.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of Child NSEntity objects.

spec.name: GetEntitiesByType
spec.description: Retrieves all active entities (Heads) of a specific type.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of NSEntity objects.

spec.name: GetNodeTypeCounts
spec.description: Retrieves a simple map of total node counts by type.
spec.returnHelp: Returns map[string]int64.

spec.name: GetNodeStats
spec.description: Retrieves comprehensive counts (Total vs Heads) for all node types.
spec.returnHelp: Returns map of type -> {total, heads}.

spec.name: ScanType
spec.description: Retrieves ALL node versions (History) for a type. DEBUG ONLY.
spec.returnHelp: Returns list of raw node maps with is_head flag.

spec.name: GetSubgraph
spec.description: Traverses the graph starting from Entity IDs.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of enriched NSEntity objects.

spec.name: CreateRoot
spec.description: Creates a new standalone root node for a forum or thread.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (ThreadID) of the newly created forum thread.

spec.name: CreateForProject
spec.description: Creates a new forum thread and links it to a project.

args.name: projectEntity
args.description: The NSEntity object of the project to associate with.

args.name: title
args.description: The title of the new forum.

args.name: author
args.description: Optional: The EntityID of the author (defaults to caller).

spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (ThreadID) of the newly created forum thread.

spec.name: Post
spec.description: Posts a new message to a forum thread.

args.name: threadID
args.description: The ID of the forum thread.

args.name: parentID
args.description: The NodeID of the message being replied to. If empty, this is a top-level post.

args.name: markdown
args.description: The markdown content of the message.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the newly created message.

spec.name: Vote
spec.description: Submits a unipolar (+1/support, 0/abstain) vote for a message.

args.name: value
args.description: The vote value, typically 1.0 for 'yes' or 0.0 for 'no'.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the NodeID of the newly created vote node.

spec.name: Rate
spec.description: Submits a bipolar (-1..+1) quality rating for a message.

args.name: reason
args.description: An optional brief justification for the rating.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the NodeID of the newly created feedback node.

spec.name: Summarize
spec.description: Generates a summary node for a message or thread.

args.name: rootID
args.description: The MessageID of the message or thread to summarize.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the NodeID of the newly created forum_summary node.

spec.name: ListThread
spec.description: Lists messages in a forum thread, sorted by timestamp. By default, only lists messages from the current epoch.

args.name: threadID
args.description: The ID of the forum thread to list.

args.name: allEpochs
args.description: If true, list messages from all epochs.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of maps, where each map represents a message.

spec.name: GetContextBundle
spec.description: Gets the thread head and recent messages as a structured JSON object. By default, only includes messages from the current epoch.

args.name: threadID
args.description: The ID of the forum thread.

args.name: count
args.description: The max number of recent messages to include (default 0 means all in current epoch).

args.name: allEpochs
args.description: If true, include messages from all epochs (count applies to total).

spec.returnHelp: Returns a JSON string containing an object with 'head' (ForumHead) and 'messages' (list of Message objects).

spec.name: ListForums
spec.description: Lists all available forum threads with their current head metadata.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a list of maps, where each map represents a forum head node's fields.

spec.name: Propose
spec.description: Posts a formal proposal message (Tier-A), changing thread state to 'Pending'.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new proposal message.

spec.name: OpenVote
spec.description: Opens a formal vote on a proposal (Tier-A), changing thread state to 'Voting'.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new vote-open message.

spec.name: Decide
spec.description: Posts a formal decision message (Tier-A), changing thread state to 'Decided'.

args.name: proposalRef
args.description: MessageID of the proposal being decided.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new decision message.

spec.name: Reopen
spec.description: Reopens a decided or closed thread (Tier-A), starting a new epoch and changing state to 'Open'.

args.name: decisionRef
args.description: MessageID of the decision being reopened.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new reopen message.

spec.name: Supersede
spec.description: Marks a thread as superseded by another (Tier-A), changing state to 'Superseded'.

args.name: successorThreadID
args.description: The ID of the thread that replaces this one.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new supersede message.

spec.name: System
spec.description: Posts a system administration message (Tier-A), e.g., to close or archive a thread.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the ID (MessageID) of the new system message.

spec.name: FromBase64

spec.returnHelp: Returns the decoded string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `encoded_string` is not a string or is invalid Base64.

spec.name: GetKind
spec.description: Extracts the event Kind from the first envelope in an ns standard event.

args.name: base64_encoded_string
args.description: The Base64 encoded Gzip data to decompress.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the decompressed original string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if the input is not a valid Base64/Gzip string.

spec.name: GetChildren
spec.description: Gets a list of node IDs of the children of a given 'array' type node.

args.name: node_id
args.description: ID of the 'array' type parent node.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a slice of child node IDs.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrNodeNotFound`, `ErrNodeWrongType`.

spec.name: Register
spec.description: Registers a new agent model configuration.

args.name: name
args.description: The logical name for the agent model (e.g., 'gpt-4-turbo').

args.name: config
args.description: A map containing model details like 'provider' and 'model'.

spec.name: Detect
spec.description: Detects the serialization format ('md' or 'ns') of a string content by checking for a '::serialization:' key.

spec.name: TrimPrefix
spec.description: Removes the prefix string from the input string if it exists.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the string with the prefix removed. If the string doesn't start with the prefix, returns the original string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if arguments are not strings.

spec.name: ToJsonString
spec.description: Converts any value (map, list, string, number, etc.) into a JSON formatted string.

args.name: pretty_print
args.description: If true, formats the JSON with indentation. Default: false.

args.name: prefix
args.description: The line prefix for pretty-printing. Default: "". Only used if pretty_print is true.

args.name: indent
args.description: The indentation string for pretty-printing. Default: "  ". Only used if pretty_print is true.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the JSON formatted string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if the value cannot be represented as JSON or if optional arguments have wrong types.

spec.name: Sleep
spec.description: Pauses execution for a specified duration. Requires 'os:exec:sleep' capability and is subject to policy time limits.

args.name: duration_seconds
args.description: The number of seconds to sleep.

spec.returnHelp: Returns nil on completion.
spec.errorConditions: ErrArgumentMismatch if duration is not a number. ErrTimeExceeded if duration is longer than the policy limit.

spec.name: Validate
spec.description: Validates a map against a Shape-Lite definition.

args.name: shape
args.description: The Shape-Lite map to validate against.

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on success, otherwise returns a validation error.
spec.errorConditions: Returns validation errors (e.g., ErrValidationTypeMismatch) on failure.

spec.name: Select
spec.description: Selects a single value from a map or list using a Path-Lite expression.

args.name: value
args.description: The map or list to select from.

args.name: path
args.description: The Path-Lite string or array-form list path.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the value found at the specified path.
spec.errorConditions: Returns selection errors (e.g., ErrMapKeyNotFound) on failure, unless 'missing_ok' is true.

spec.name: analyzeNSSyntax
spec.description: Analyzes a NeuroScript string for syntax errors. Returns a list of maps, where each map details an error. Returns an empty list if no errors are found.
spec.returnHelp:
Returns a list (slice) of maps. Each map represents a syntax error and contains the following keys:
- `Line`: number (1-based) - The line number of the error.
- `Column`: number (0-based) - The character types.Position in the line where the error occurred.
- `Msg`: string - The error message.
- `OffendingSymbol`: string - The text of the token that caused the error (may be empty).
- `SourceName`: string - Identifier for the source (e.g., 'nsSyntaxAnalysisToolInput').
An empty list is returned if no syntax errors are found.
spec.example:
set script_to_check = `func myFunc means
  set x = 
endfunc`
set error_list = tool.analyzeNSSyntax(script_to_check)
if tool.List.IsEmpty(error_list) == false
  set first_error = tool.List.Get(error_list, 0)
  emit "First error on line " + first_error["Line"] + ": " + first_error["Msg"]
endif
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is supplied. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `nsScriptContent` is not a string, or if the interpreter instance is nil. The underlying call to `AnalyzeNSSyntaxInternal` might return an error (e.g. `ErrInternal`) if there's an unexpected issue during its processing, though it aims to return an error list.

spec.name: Replace
spec.description: Replaces occurrences of a substring with another, up to a specified count.

args.name: input_string
args.description: The string to perform replacements on.

args.name: count
args.description: Maximum number of replacements. Use -1 for all.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the string with specified replacements made.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `input_string`, `old_substring`, or `new_substring` are not strings, or if `count` is not an integer.

spec.name: Add
spec.description: Adds a new capsule to the runtime registry by parsing its content. Requires a privileged interpreter.

spec.name: Reverse
spec.description: Returns a *new* list with the elements in reverse order.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a new list with the elements of the input 'list' in reverse order. The original list is not modified.
spec.errorConditions: None expected.

spec.name: ListPackages
spec.description: Runs 'go list -json' for specified patterns in a target directory. Returns a list of maps, each describing a package.

args.name: target_directory
args.description: Optional. The directory relative to the sandbox root to run 'go list'. Defaults to '.' (sandbox root).

args.name: patterns
args.description: Optional. A list of package patterns (e.g., './...', 'example.com/project/...'). Defaults to ['./...'].

spec.returnHelp: Returns a slice of maps, where each map is a JSON object representing a Go package as output by 'go list -json'. Returns an empty slice on command failure or if JSON decoding fails.
spec.errorConditions: ErrValidationTypeMismatch if patterns arg contains non-string elements; ErrInternalTool if execution helper fails internally or JSON decoding fails; ErrConfiguration if sandbox is not set; ErrInternalSecurity for path validation issues. 'go list' command failures are reported in its output map rather than a Go error from the tool.

spec.name: dumpClones
spec.description: Logs the state of all registered interpreter clones to the host's stdout.

spec.name: Add
spec.description: Adds file contents to the index.

spec.name: Add
spec.description: Calculates the sum of two numbers (integers or decimals). Strings convertible to numbers are accepted.

args.name: num1
args.description: The first number (or numeric string) to add.

args.name: num2
args.description: The second number (or numeric string) to add.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the sum of num1 and num2 as a float64. Both inputs are expected to be (or be coercible to) numbers.
spec.errorConditions: Returns an 'ErrInternalTool' if arguments cannot be processed as float64 (this scenario should ideally be caught by input validation before the tool function is called).

spec.name: BytesToBase64
spec.description: Converts a string into a Base64 encoded string representing its UTF-8 bytes.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the Base64 encoded string representing the UTF-8 bytes.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided or input is not a string.

spec.name: AppendInPlace
spec.description: Efficiently returns a list with the element added. Intended for building lists in loops.

args.name: element
args.description: The element to append (can be nil).

spec.returnHelp: Returns the list with the 'element' added to the end. Although named 'InPlace' for intent, it returns the potentially re-allocated list.
spec.example: set my_list = [1, 2]\nset my_list = tool.List.AppendInPlace(my_list, 3) // my_list is now [1, 2, 3]
spec.errorConditions: None expected, as input validation ensures 'list' is a slice. Appending 'nil' is allowed.

spec.name: Contains
spec.description: Checks if a list contains a specific element (using deep equality comparison).

args.name: element
args.description: The element to search for (can be nil).

spec.returnHelp: Returns true if the 'list' contains the specified 'element', using deep equality for comparison. Returns false otherwise.
spec.errorConditions: None expected. Comparison with 'nil' elements is handled.

spec.name: Head
spec.description: Returns the first element of the list, or nil if the list is empty.

args.name: list
args.description: The list to get the head from.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the first element of the 'list'. If the list is empty, it returns nil.
spec.errorConditions: None expected. Returns nil for an empty list.

spec.name: Rest
spec.description: Returns a *new* list containing all elements except the first. Returns an empty list if the input list has 0 or 1 element.

args.name: list
args.description: The list to get the rest from.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a new list containing all elements of the input 'list' except the first. If the list has 0 or 1 element, it returns an empty list. The original list is not modified.
spec.errorConditions: None expected. Returns an empty list for lists with 0 or 1 element.

spec.name: def_global_const
spec.description: Defines a global, immutable constant. Privileged operation.

spec.name: Walk
spec.description: Recursively walks a directory, returning a list of maps describing files/subdirectories found.

args.name: path
args.description: Relative path to the directory to walk.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a slice of maps, each describing a file/subdir. Skips the root dir itself. Returns nil on error.
spec.errorConditions: ErrArgumentMismatch; ErrConfiguration; ErrSecurityPath; ErrFileNotFound; ErrPathNotDirectory; ErrPermissionDenied; ErrIOFailed; ErrInternal.

spec.name: ParseJsonString
spec.description: Parses JSON data from a plain string into a map or list.

args.name: json_string
args.description: The plain string representing JSON data.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the parsed map or list.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if input is not a string or is invalid JSON.

spec.description: Sets the value of an existing leaf or simple-type node.

args.name: node_id
args.description: ID of the leaf or simple-type node to modify.

args.name: value
args.description: The new value for the node.

spec.returnHelp: Returns nil on success.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrNodeNotFound`, `ErrCannotSetValueOnType`.

spec.name: Commit
spec.description: Commits staged changes.

spec.name: Get
spec.description: Safely gets the element at a specific index (0-based). Returns nil or the optional default value if the index is out of bounds.

args.name: default
args.description: Optional default value if index is out of bounds.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the element at the specified 0-based 'index' in the 'list'. If the index is out of bounds, it returns the provided 'default' value. If no 'default' is provided and the index is out of bounds, it returns nil.
spec.errorConditions: Returns nil or the default value if the index is out of bounds. No specific error type is returned for out-of-bounds access by design.

spec.name: GetTimestamp
spec.description: Extracts the event Timestamp (TS) from the first envelope in an ns standard event.

spec.name: Build

args.name: target
args.description: Optional. The build target (e.g., a package path or './...'). Defaults to './...'.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with 'stdout', 'stderr', 'exit_code' (int64), and 'success' (bool) from the 'go build <target>' command.
spec.errorConditions: ErrInvalidArgument if optional target is not a string; ErrConfiguration if sandbox is not set; ErrInternalSecurity for path validation issues. Command execution failures are reported within the returned map.

spec.description: Lists the names of all configured agent models.

spec.name: Exists

args.name: name
args.description: The logical name of the model to check.

spec.name: Pull

args.name: metadata_key

args.name: metadata_value

spec.returnHelp: Returns nil on success.

spec.name: Prepend

spec.returnHelp: Returns the value of the environment variable as a string. Returns an empty string if the variable is not set.
spec.errorConditions: ErrArgumentMismatch if varName is empty or not a string. Returns an empty string for non-existent variables, which is not considered an error.

spec.name: List

spec.name: Staticcheck

args.name: target
args.description: Optional. The target for 'staticcheck' (e.g., a package path or './...'). Defaults to './...'.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with 'stdout', 'stderr', 'exit_code' (int64), and 'success' (bool) from the 'staticcheck <target>' command. 'stdout' usually contains the diagnostics.
spec.errorConditions: ErrInvalidArgument if optional target is not a string; ErrToolExecutionFailed if 'staticcheck' command fails (e.g. not found, or internal error), reported via the toolExecuteCommand structure.

spec.name: Delete
spec.description: Deletes an agent model configuration.

args.name: name
args.description: The logical name of the model to delete.

spec.name: Divide
spec.description: Calculates the division of two numbers (num1 / num2). Returns float. Handles division by zero.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the result of num1 / num2 as a float64. Both inputs are expected to be (or be coercible to) numbers.
spec.errorConditions: Returns 'ErrDivisionByZero' if num2 is 0. Returns an 'ErrInternalTool' if arguments cannot be processed as float64 (should be caught by validation).

spec.name: Append
spec.description: Appends content to a specific file. Creates the file and parent directories if needed. Returns 'OK' on success.
spec.returnHelp: Returns 'OK' on success. Returns nil on error.
spec.errorConditions: ErrArgumentMismatch; ErrConfiguration; ErrSecurityPath; ErrCannotCreateDir; ErrPermissionDenied; ErrPathNotFile; ErrIOFailed.

spec.name: Join

spec.returnHelp: Returns a single string created by joining the elements of string_list with the separator.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `string_list` is not a list or `separator` is not a string.

spec.name: ToBase64
spec.description: Encodes a string using standard Base64 encoding.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the Base64 encoded string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `input_string` is not a string.

spec.name: ToHex
spec.description: Encodes a string into a hexadecimal representation.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the hex-encoded string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `input_string` is not a string.

spec.name: ToJSON
spec.description: Converts a tree structure back into a pretty-printed JSON string.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a pretty-printed JSON string representation of the tree.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrTreeJSONMarshal`, `ErrInternal`.

spec.name: Select

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map indicating success. Returns nil on error.

args.description: Unique ID of the 'object' type node to modify.

args.name: attribute_key
args.description: The key of the attribute to set.

args.name: child_node_id
args.description: The ID of an existing node to associate with the key.

spec.returnHelp: Returns nil on success.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrNodeNotFound`, `ErrTreeNodeNotObject`.

spec.name: Get
spec.description: Retrieves the full configuration of a registered agent model.

args.name: name
args.description: The logical name of the model to retrieve.

spec.name: ToUpper
spec.description: Converts a string to uppercase.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the uppercase version of the input string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `input_string` is not a string.

spec.name: TrimSpace
spec.description: Removes leading and trailing whitespace from a string.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the string with leading and trailing whitespace removed.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `input_string` is not a string.

spec.name: FromHex
spec.description: Decodes a string from its hexadecimal representation.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the decoded string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `encoded_string` is not a string or is invalid hex.

spec.name: GetNodeByPath
spec.description: Retrieves a node from a tree using a dot-separated path expression.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a map containing details of the node found at the specified path.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrNodeNotFound`, `ErrKeyNotFound`, `ErrNodeWrongType`.

spec.name: Sleep
spec.description: Pauses the script execution for a specified duration.

args.name: duration_seconds
args.description: The number of seconds to sleep (can be a fraction).

spec.returnHelp: Returns true on successful completion of the sleep duration.

spec.name: GetAllPayloads
spec.description: Extracts all coalesced payloads from a raw ns standard event into a list of maps.

args.name: event_object
args.description: The event object, typically from an 'on event' handler.

spec.name: LineCount
spec.description: Counts the number of lines in the given string content.

args.name: content_string
args.description: The string content in which to count lines.

spec.returnHelp: Returns an integer representing the number of lines in the string. Lines are typically separated by '\n'. An empty string results in 0 lines. If the string is not empty and does not end with a newline, the last line is still counted.
spec.example:
tool.LineCount("line1
line2
line3") // Returns 3
tool.LineCount("line1
line2") // Returns 2
tool.LineCount("") // Returns 0
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `content_string` is not a string.

spec.name: Compress
spec.description: Compresses a string using Gzip and returns the result as a Base64-encoded string.
spec.returnHelp: Returns the Gzip compressed and Base64 encoded string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if `input_string` is not a string.

spec.name: ParseFromJsonBase64
spec.description: Parses JSON data from a Base64 encoded string (representing bytes) into a map or list.

args.name: base64_string
args.description: The Base64 encoded string representing JSON byte data.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the parsed map or list.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if input is not a string, invalid Base64, or invalid JSON.

spec.name: GetRoot
spec.description: Retrieves the root node of the tree as a map.
spec.returnHelp: Returns a map containing details of the root node.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrInternal`.

spec.name: FindNodes
spec.description: Finds nodes within a tree that match specific criteria.

args.name: start_node_id
args.description: ID of the node to start searching from.

args.name: max_results
args.description: Maximum number of results to return.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a slice of node IDs matching the query.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch`, `ErrInvalidArgument`, `ErrTreeNotFound`, `ErrNodeNotFound`, `ErrTreeInvalidQuery`, `ErrInternal`.

spec.name: IsEmpty
spec.description: Returns true if the list has zero elements, false otherwise.
spec.returnHelp: Returns true if the 'list' contains zero elements, and false otherwise.
spec.errorConditions: None expected.

spec.name: LoadScript
spec.description: Parses a string of NeuroScript code and loads its functions and event handlers into the current interpreter's scope. Does not execute any code.

args.name: script_content
args.description: A string containing the NeuroScript code to load.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with keys 'functions_loaded', 'event_handlers_loaded', and 'metadata', which contains the file-level metadata from the script header.
spec.example:
set result = tool.script.LoadScript(":: purpose: example
func f()means
endfunc")
emit result["metadata"]["purpose"]
spec.errorConditions: ErrArgumentMismatch if script_content is not a string or is missing. ErrSyntax if the script has syntax errors. ErrExecutionFailed if a function or event handler conflicts with an existing one (e.g., duplicate function name).

spec.name: IsValid
spec.description: Checks if a handle is valid (exists in the active registry).
spec.returnHelp: Returns true if the handle points to a live object, false otherwise.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the argument is not a handle.

spec.name: Substring
spec.description: Returns a portion of the string (rune-based indexing), from start_index for a given length.

args.name: input_string
args.description: The string to take a substring from.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the specified substring (rune-based). Returns an empty string if length is zero or if start_index is out of bounds (after clamping). Gracefully handles out-of-bounds for non-negative start_index and length by returning available characters.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if arguments are not of the correct type. Returns `ErrListIndexOutOfBounds` (with `ErrorCodeBounds`) if `start_index` or `length` are negative.

spec.name: BytesFromBase64
spec.description: Decodes a Base64 string (representing bytes) into a string, assuming UTF-8 encoding.

args.name: base64_string

spec.returnHelp: Returns the decoded UTF-8 string.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` if input is not a string, invalid Base64, or not valid UTF-8.

spec.name: Register
spec.description: Registers a new provider account configuration.

args.name: name
args.description: The logical name for the account (e.g., 'openai-prod').

args.name: config
args.description: A map containing account details like 'kind', 'provider', and 'apiKey'.

spec.name: Compose
spec.description: Creates a valid ns standard event from its constituent parts.

args.name: payload
args.description: The data payload of the event.

args.name: id
args.description: Optional event ID. If omitted, a new one is generated.

spec.name: Execute
spec.description: Executes an arbitrary shell command. WARNING: Use with extreme caution due to security risks. Command path validation is basic. Consider using specific tools (e.g., GoBuild, GitAdd) instead.

args.name: command
args.description: The command or executable path (must not contain path separators like '/' or '\').

args.name: args_list
args.description: A list of string arguments for the command.

args.name: directory
args.description: Optional directory (relative to sandbox) to execute the command in. Defaults to sandbox root.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map containing 'stdout' (string), 'stderr' (string), 'exit_code' (int), and 'success' (bool) of the executed command. 'success' is true if the command exits with code 0, false otherwise. The command is executed within the sandboxed environment.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if an incorrect number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` or `ErrorCodeType` if 'command' is not a string, 'args_list' is not a list of strings, or 'directory' is not a string. Returns `ErrSecurityViolation` if the 'command' path is deemed suspicious (e.g., contains path separators or shell metacharacters). Returns `ErrInternal` if the internal FileAPI is not available. May return path-related errors (e.g., `ErrFileNotFound`, `ErrPathNotDirectory`, `ErrPermissionDenied`) if the specified 'directory' is invalid or inaccessible. If the command itself executes but fails (non-zero exit code), 'success' in the result map will be false, and 'stderr' may contain error details. OS-level execution errors are also captured in 'stderr'.

spec.name: GetID
spec.description: Extracts the event ID from the first envelope in an ns standard event.

spec.name: Check
spec.description: Checks Go code validity using 'go list -e -json <target>' within the sandbox. Returns a map indicating success and error details.

args.name: target
args.description: Target Go package path or file path relative to sandbox (e.g., './pkg/core', 'main.go').

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with 'check_success' (bool) and 'error_details' (string). 'check_success' is true if 'go list -e -json' finds no errors in the target's JSON output. 'error_details' contains messages if errors are found or if the command fails.
spec.errorConditions: ErrConfiguration if sandbox is not set; ErrInternalSecurity for path validation issues. Command execution issues or JSON parsing errors result in 'check_success':false and details in 'error_details'.

spec.name: Merge
spec.description: Joins two or more development histories together.

spec.name: HasPrefix
spec.description: Checks if a string starts with a prefix.
spec.returnHelp: Returns true if the input_string starts with the prefix, false otherwise.
spec.errorConditions: Returns `ErrArgumentMismatch` if the wrong number of arguments is provided. Returns `ErrInvalidArgument` (with `ErrorCodeType`) if `input_string` or `prefix` are not strings.

spec.name: ReplaceRegex
spec.description: Replaces all occurrences of a regex pattern in a string with a replacement string. Requires 'str:use:regex' capability.

args.name: replacement
args.description: The string to replace matches with.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a new string with all replacements made.
spec.example: str.ReplaceRegex(pattern: "\\s+", input_string: "a  b c", replacement: "-") // Returns "a-b-c"
spec.errorConditions: ErrInvalidArgument if the regex pattern is invalid.

spec.name: Now
spec.description: Returns the current system time as a 'timedate' value.
spec.returnHelp: A 'timedate' value representing the moment the tool was called.

spec.name: List
spec.description: Lists the names of all configured provider accounts.

spec.name: Input
spec.description: Displays a message and waits for user input from standard input. Returns the input as a string.

args.name: message
args.description: The message to display to the user before waiting for input. If null or empty, no prompt message is printed.

spec.returnHelp: Returns the string entered by the user, with trailing newline characters trimmed. Returns an empty string and an error if reading input fails.
spec.errorConditions: ErrorCodeType if the prompt message argument is provided but not a string; ErrorCodeIOFailed if reading from standard input fails (e.g., EOF).

spec.name: Test
spec.description: Runs 'go test' for a specified target in the sandbox. Defaults to './...'.

args.name: target
args.description: Optional. The test target (e.g., a package path or './...'). Defaults to './...'.

spec.returnHelp: Returns a map with 'stdout', 'stderr', 'exit_code' (int64), and 'success' (bool) from the 'go test <target>' command.
spec.errorConditions: ErrInvalidArgument if optional target is not a string; ErrConfiguration if sandbox is not set; ErrInternalSecurity for path validation issues. Command execution failures are reported within the returned map.

spec.name: Push
spec.description: Pushes committed changes to a remote repository.

spec.name: Parse
spec.description: Parses a raw capsule string (Markdown or NeuroScript) and returns its metadata fields.

spec.name: GetPayload
spec.description: Extracts the core payload from a raw ns standard event, unwrapping the outer envelope.

args.name: event_object
args.description: The event object, typically from an 'on event' handler.

spec.name: Diff
spec.description: Shows changes between commits, commit and working tree, etc.
